result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Ardie J Thomas in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Pl to all charges in 16CF479; 15CF1360 & 14CF285 are DRI. In 15CF173, the State moves to dismiss with the agreement not to prosecute. The State agrees to follow the PSI.
P-NC to all
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered

Cts 1 & 2: 946.49(1)(b)-Felony BJ; Ct 3: 943.50(1m)(b)-RT-intentionally take. Conditions:  No contact with victim store, Kohls Department Store, except for restitution purposes.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Ardie J Thomas in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Defendant Ardie J Thomas in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
The State indicates that there is a resolution and asks for a COP date. Parties stipulate to modifying bond to signature bonds; same amount and same conditions

BTC: Bond modifiation is granted. All files will be signature bonds; same amount as currently ordered with same conditions  Plea hearing scheduled for October 13, 2016 at 11:00 am.
From Defendant.

Defendant Ardie J Thomas in court with attorney Erin Joy (Larsen) Preston.  Defendant Ardie J Thomas in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Defense is asking that bond be converted back to the original amounts - argument put on the record. The State is concerned that 16CF479, deft indicates she has a brain injury and although deft has not failed to come to court as ordered, she continues to commit crimes. The State asks the Court to deny bond modification.

BTC: bond modification is denied.
For Bail
Plea hearing on September 12, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 19, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Ardie J Thomas in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Defendant Ardie J Thomas in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court Reporter: Sandra Campbell.
Parties have reviewed report of Dr. Endres. Parties stipulate to the findings. Defense asks that bond be reduced to the amounts as previously set and require deft to live with Ms. Golden. The State objects citing the bail jumping charges and deft's history. 

BTC: Defendant is found competent to go forward. 16CF479 is to be set for preliminary hearing. 
          Bond modification is denied  Status conference scheduled for July 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.
From def re: bond.

Defendant Ardie J Thomas in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Defendant Ardie J Thomas in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.
Defense asks that bond be modified as set forth in the motion filed. The State leaves the issue of bond soley up to the Court.

BTC: Motion to modify bail is denied.  Competency hearing scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Evaluation has been received and reviewed by both parties and the court.  Report recommends an in-patient evaluation.  Defendant is taken into custody to be held without bond on all 4 cases. JT on 15Cf case set for May is removed from the courts calendar  Review hearing scheduled for July 15, 2016 at 11:00 am.
